comment: Stay on top of this class from the get-go! My recommendation would be to read from the textbook if youre unable to keep pace with Dr. Hornbuckles lecture while taking a substantial amount of notes. Her teaching style is unique and not so hard to appreciate once you understand the course content.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria

comment: Is always 5 minutes late or more for the class she is teaching and often brags about how she is tenured and has kids so she "can't be fired". She told us not to bother complaining or she would make sure we didn't pass. Half the test is essay portion she will give zero credit even if you are correct and match the textbook and her own notes.

For an intro class, she makes it way harder than it should be. That being said, I feel I shouldn't have even recieved a D for the class. She is nice but can get confusing, she tests on some random things that no that she doesn't stress very much in class, and almost never tests on what she does stress. Too many notes with too little time to take.

-Essay MC and short answer exams.  -She's terrible at trying to explain herself.  -Has the rudest personality when it comes to students asking questions.  -Has a condescending demeanor.  -Makes your hand hurt from all of the note taking you do.  -Not much book usage, but if you skip & you have the book use it! thats where her info is from.

Tests are structured in multiple choice, fill in the blank, and the dreaded essay questions.  The multiple choice are piece of cake, fill in the blank a little more difficult; but the essay questions are ridiculous.  Easy topics such as the "sliding filament theory" or "Na-K pump", but good luck on getting a good grade.

I had her for nutrition as well as 4500 and i LOVE her. You HAVE to go to class. She doesn't give out her pwpts, so take good notes. DO THE STUDY GUIDE. If you took good notes and can fill out all the info on the study guide you will make an A. She gives lots of quizzes but its good bc they make you study more frequently. 100% recommend her.

Easily the most unknowledgeable professor I have ever had. I cannot believe she has a PhD in exercise physiology. She is unable to answer even basic student questions during class, and only is able to regurgitate her very sloppy slides. Very, very poor quality teacher. She is nice, but obviously chose the wrong profession.
By far one of the worst professors I have had at KSU. Very rude, not helpful and tests way harder then they should be. Exams are from notes but asks questions that are detailed. AVOID taking her!

Her tests are part multiple choice and part essay/fill in the blank. If you study you can easily make an A. She has difficulty answering any students questions which is frustrating. Very slow at getting work/grades back. Can be condescending. For a more well rounded learning experience take someone else.

I love Dr. Hornbuckle! I took her for Nutrition before 4500. She has high expectations for her students but she genuinely wants you to do well. She is funny and has a great way of explaining the material. Attending class and studying often are important if you want to do well.

This class is not that bad if you study her notes. She does not give you the power points, so you have to write her notes each day and hope she doesn't go too fast.  If you study her notes throughly you will do fine. Her tests come straight from her notes, but she grades the essays hard. Dr. H is very willing to help students if you just ask

I loved Dr. Hornbuckle's classes.  I took her for 4150 prior to 4500.  She is definitely tough, and her tests are difficult, but she appreciates students that makes an effort.  She can be tricky to schedule an appointment with, but worth it to make it happen.  Tough teacher, but you will learn a lot if you put in the effort.  Overall good teacher.

Nice as a person but do not talk to her about school. she doesnt know how to use lab equipment grad students show her how.. she will not give sympathy for anyone. very hard tests, does not teach material instead she reads off a powerpoint slide show given from the textbooks website. Multiple pages of notes per day. does not put powerpoint's online!

Tests are hard. Lectures are point by point from textbook. Covers A LOT of material. Very slow at getting work back, so have to ask for grades. Really nice and friendly but quite a hard class. Expects graduate school level of work. Doesn't answer questions but will do research for answer. Doesn't explain everything clearly, is sometimes confusing.

New to KSU. Tests are ridiculously hard. Reads from power points that she gets from the book's website during class which makes it boring. Changes the slides a little and if you type during class, it's hard to learn. Can't answer questions that students ask. Avoid her class if you can!!!
